mainEntity.name: What is a food licence?

acceptedAnswer.text: Food licence or FSSAI licence is granted to all manufacturers, traders, restaurants carrying out any food business which may involve manufacturing or processing.

mainEntity.name: Kind of Business who needs FSSAI/FOOD License?

acceptedAnswer.text: The persons involved in the food business, such as manufacturing, transportation, distribution and storage of food articles/products are also mandatorily required to have a FSSAI registration to carry on their food business.

mainEntity.name: Why food licence is necessary?

acceptedAnswer.text: A food licence is essential to be able to be a legal producer and distributor of food. It is a requirement to pass hygiene and safety regulations to provide clean food to the masses. Without an FSSAI food licence, business operations may face violation as per the Food Safety and Standards Act of 2006.

mainEntity.name: Why is a food licence used?

acceptedAnswer.text: The licence helps to curb accusations of food adulteration and the use of cheap food. Unsafe ingredients.

acceptedAnswer.text: Registering authority may cancel the licence/registration.

acceptedAnswer.text:

mainEntity.name: Where can I apply for my FSSAI licence?

acceptedAnswer.text: FBOs can obtain FSSAI registration online by filling and submitting the FSSAI registration form, i.e. Form A (application for Registration) or Form B (application for State and Central License) on the FoSCoS portal. The FBOs can also register offline by submitting Form A or Form B to the Food and Safety Department. Get effortless FSSAI registration assistance today! Contact us at the provided number and our team will guide you through the process step by step.

mainEntity.name: What is the registration cost?

acceptedAnswer.text: The FSSAI state licence fees range from INR 2000/- to 5000/- a year.

mainEntity.name: What are the documents required to apply?

acceptedAnswer.text: Photo ID and address proof issued by government authority of proprietor/partner/directors/authorised signatory.

mainEntity.name: What is FSSAI?

acceptedAnswer.text: It is an independent organisation that reports to the Indian governmentâ€™s ministry of health & family welfare.

mainEntity.name: What are the types of food licence?

acceptedAnswer.text:
The types of food licence are:
- Central licence
- State licence
- Basic registration

mainEntity.name: Is food licence valid all over India?

acceptedAnswer.text: FSSAI State licences are given to food business owners who operate inside a single state. At the same time, the FSSAI Central License is given to food business owners who want to operate in multiple states, on a centralized system.

mainEntity.name: When should I renew my food licence?

acceptedAnswer.text: Before 30 days of the current registration. For more information, call +9059145190.

mainEntity.name: What are the consequences of not following the rules and regulations?

acceptedAnswer.text: You may face a heavy penalty.

mainEntity.name: What is the procedure for applying?

acceptedAnswer.text:
1. Photo of food business operator
2. Document for identity proof like ration card, voter ID card, PAN card, driving licence, passport, Aadhar card, senior citizens card, Department-issued ID
3. Supporting documents (if any): NOC by municipality/panchayat, health NOC.
